pluginstrument.description:
ZiboMod minimal : 4.0_6.5
Here's a new release of an External 2D EFB Tablet working on Air Manager / Air Player Suite from Sim Innovations https://www.siminnovations.com/
See Logic.lua for changelog
For now The only requirement is at least Air Manager 3.5 (still require a Sim Innovations Air Manager Desktop license purchase)
https://www.siminnovations.com/api3/download.php?product_type=APPLICATION&application_group_type=AIR_MANAGER&beta=false&platform=WINDOWS&program_compilation=HOME_USE
from here http://siminnovations.com/wiki/index.php?title=Air_Manager_3.x_Installation
EFB Show/Hide command available in X-Plane : ------------------------------------------ Please : - add the Z2DXP.efb folder found in "documentation\Z2DXP.efb_PLUGIN_and_README\" folder from this instrument to the following path : "...\B737-800X\plugins\xlua\scripts", so we get "...\B737-800X\plugins\xlua\scripts\Z2DXP.efb\" - then bind a button or keys to the following command in X-Plane / Settings / : "Toggle Z2DXP EFB Tablet Visibility" (Z2DXP/EFB/toggle_switch/show_z2dxp_efb)
On Air Manager for Desktop, the panel is designed t obe displayed on a standard 1920 x 1080 monitor by default (we may have to adapt if resolution is different)
AIR MANAGER Panel tab ---------------------
- Create the Panel Z2DXP EFB based on the "Premade panel" : Boeing B737-800X - Z2DXP EFB Panel - Select your Display - Select the Layout "Z2DXP EFB ..."
Let the panel to display on full screen
in[Window preferences]
check"Locked" check"Always on Top" check"Click thru"
[Background mode]
check"Transparent"
AIR MANAGER Settings tab --------------------
in[Graphics]
check"DirectX 11"
AIR MANAGER Panel tab -----------------
expand the Panel tree and select the "Z2DXP EFB Tablet for ZiboMod" instrument
in[Position within panel]
set<Left> to 260 value for the EFB to be centered on the monitor
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Enjoy Flying with ZiboMod Boeing B737-800X
Regards
See Logic.lua for changelog
